oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Poets and Prophets program - Mike Reid - 2017-03-04
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with and performances by singer/songwriter Mike Reid from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on March 4, 2017. Program hosted by Michael Gray.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mike Reid;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (01:50) Opening announcements by Abi Tapia / (03:32) Opening comments by Michael Gray with introduction of past songwriter honorees in the crowd and introduction of Mike Reid / (10:15) Reid performs the song Everywhere on piano / (14:30) Talks about inspiration for and the writing of the song Everywhere / (18:41) Talks about his childhood and background growing up in Altoona Pennsylvania / (20:57) Musical inspirations / (22:53) Starting to write his first songs / (23:58) Influence of sports in his life / (25:50) Playing football at Penn State and his areas of study / (29:43) Audio from video of Mike Reid created by NFL films / (34:09) Mike's assessment of his NFL career and his dream to be a writer / (37:56) Retiring from the NFL and joining a band / (39:06) Starting to play listening rooms as a solo act / (40:44) Audience's he was playing for at the time and Steve Goodman story /

(42:25) Jerry Jeff Walker being the first artist to record a Mike Reid song and story / (45:00) Circumstances around moving to Nashville in 1980 / (47:48) Lack of familiarity with country music and finding the strong songwriting community in Nashville / (49:08) Hearing Ronnie Milsap's recording of Misery Love Company and having an epiphany / (50:00) Struggling with the idea of writing a hit song and working with Rob Galbraith / (52:51) Advice he received from Galbraith / (54:04) Talks about Ronnie Milsap hits and writing for Ronnie / (55:22) Reid performs the song Stranger In My House on piano / (01:00:27) Working together with Milsap on the song Old Folks / (01:01:55) Circumstances leading up to Reid signing a recording contract as a solo artist / (01:03:27) Having a hit record career and the pitfalls of that / (01:09:33) Songwriting with Allen Shamblin and their approaches to songwriting / (01:13:03) Comments on his thoughts on his songs /
